docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Sept. 24--Alfredo Palacios and Americo Chioldi, old Socialist warhorses, were named last night by the Socialist National Convention as the party's candidates for President and Vice President, respectively, in the November elections.
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Sept. 24--Alfredo Palacios and Americo Chioldi, old Socialist warhorses, were named last night by the Socialist National Convention as the party's candidates for President and Vice President, respectively, in the November elections.
docs.abstract: Socialist candidates picked; all candidates except Peron and Quijano accept publicly; Socialist conv authorizes exec com to make any changes necessitated by future events; all candidates listed

headline.main: SOCIALISTS CHOOSE ARGENTINE SLATE; Palacios Presidential Choice, With Ghioldi Running Mate-- Major Parties Fill Lists

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Sept. 24 (AP)-- Emergency allocations of 15,800 metric tons of newsprint were recommended today for ten countries "in special need."

docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Sept. 27--The five-nation committee that sought to find a formula within which the Union of South Africa would agree to comply with a decision of the International Court of Justice regarding South-west Africa, today reported...
docs.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Sept. 27--The five-nation committee that sought to find a formula within which the Union of South Africa would agree to comply with a decision of the International Court of Justice regarding South-west Africa, today reported failure in its efforts.
docs.abstract: 5-nation UN com fails to get Union to comply with Internatl Ct decision requiring Capetown to rept on area adm and to forward petitions from inhabitants

headline.main: U.N. UNIT FAILS IN BID ON AFRICAN MANDATE

docs.snippet: CHICAGO, Sept. 28--Dr. Alberto Gainza Paz, the self-exiled Buenos Aires publisher who is regarded as a symbol in the world-wide fight for freedom of the press, said here today that he was not surprised at reports of a revolt in Argentina.
docs.lead_paragraph: CHICAGO, Sept. 28--Dr. Alberto Gainza Paz, the self-exiled Buenos Aires publisher who is regarded as a symbol in the world-wide fight for freedom of the press, said here today that he was not surprised at reports of a revolt in Argentina.
docs.abstract: testimonial dinner sponsored by 7 newspaper orgns, Chicago; he speaks

headline.main: NEWS NO SURPRISE TO EXILED EDITOR; Gainza Paz, Former Head of La Prensa, Says He Heard Much Discontent With Peron

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Sept. 28--Groups of Argentina's armed forces revolted against the Peron Government this morning. At 3:30 P.M., in a speech from the balcony of Casa Rosada, or Gov  ernment House, President Juan Peron announced that the bulk of the Army,...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Sept. 28--Groups of Argentina's armed forces revolted against the Peron Government this morning. At 3:30 P.M., in a speech from the balcony of Casa Rosada, or Gov ernment House, President Juan Peron announced that the bulk of the Army, Navy and Air Force had remained loyal and that the revolt had been crushed
docs.abstract: Armed forces groups revolt; map; Peron repts most remain loyal and revolt easily crushed; issues orders to halt plot; threatens hanging; illus; retired Gens Menendez and Rawson named plot leaders: Gens Guaycochea and G Zinny linked; Labor Confed calls gen strike to back Adm; censorship; Min Borlenghi repts Nov elections unaffected; Senora Peron hails Govt supporters; Menendez, 80 Opposition leaders and others held; rebels flee to Uruguay; Capt Baroja comment; Uruguay will return all Argentine mil machines

headline.main: Argentine Revolt Is Quelled; Only Handful of Shots Fired; Airmen Also Implicated

byline.original: By FOSTER HAILEY Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: PREPARATIONS are already under way for the next long week-end, which starts Columbus Day, Oct. 12. A legal  holiday in most states, the day falls on Friday this year, giving hundreds of workers an opportunity for short vacations.

docs.snippet: Federal officials cracked a $100,000,000-a-year international gold smuggling ring yesterday with the arraignment of three men on charges of illegal trafficking in the metal.
docs.lead_paragraph: Federal officials cracked a $100,000,000-a-year international gold smuggling ring yesterday with the arraignment of three men on charges of illegal trafficking in the metal.
docs.abstract: Treas Dept cracks $100-million-a-yr smuggling ring, NYC; E Popper, R J Carroll, S Diamant charged with violating Trading With the Enemy Act; operation described

headline.main: BIG SMUGGLING RING IN GOLD BROKEN UP; 3 Arraigned in $100,000,000 Shipments to Black Markets in South America, Europe U.S. BREAKS RING TO SMUGGLE GOLD Three Men Watched
